title: WhatsApp to end support for older Android phones from January 1, 2025: Full list here - The Financial Express
summary:
WhatsApp to End Support for Older Android Phones Starting January 1, 2025

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Financial Express

In a significant move, Meta announced that WhatsApp will cease to support older Android devices beginning January 1, 2025. Users operating on Android KitKat and older versions will be unable to run the app, impacting millions globally.

Key Points

  • WhatsApp support will end for all Android devices running KitKat or older.
  • Users are encouraged to back up their data to newer devices.
  • Affected brands include Samsung, Motorola, HTC, LG, and Sony.
  • Meta previously announced similar plans for older iPhones.
  • Important backup tips provided to help users transition smoothly.

"If you are still using one of these devices as your daily driver, the logical way forward is to back up all your WhatsApp data to a newer device."

As WhatsApp phases out support for older systems, users must take proactive measures to move their data to updated devices to avoid losing access to their chat histories.
newTitle: WhatsApp to End Support for Older Android Phones Starting January 1, 2025

title: Should chess players invest in their diet? - Sportstar
summary:
Should Chess Players Invest in Their Diet?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Hindu

The article explores the significant impact of diet on chess performance, arguing that nutrition plays a vital role in mental acuity and endurance during tournaments.

  • The myth that chess players burn 6,000 calories during tournaments is debunked; actual increased energy expenditure is roughly 200-300 calories.
  • Proper nutrition can improve memory, decision-making, focus, and stress management essential for optimal chess performance.
  • Certain foods, such as dark chocolate, nuts, and low-GI carbohydrates, are recommended for sustaining energy and sharp thinking.
  • Intermittent fasting and nootropic foods are noted as emerging trends to boost mental clarity.
  • Genetics can influence dietary needs, suggesting a personalized approach to nutrition may enhance performance.
“Chess is more than a game; it’s a test of endurance, focus, and mental agility.”

Ultimately, investing in a strategic diet may offer chess players a competitive edge, transforming their approach to the game.
newTitle: Should Chess Players Invest in Their Diet?

Google has released Android 16 Developer Preview 2 (DP2), which allows testing of new features and APIs. This update aims to enhance battery life and introduces a new fingerprint unlock functionality for Pixel devices.

  • Android 16 DP2 rolls out earlier than usual in 2025 as Google prepares for the Pixel 10 series.
  • The new setting, Screen-off Fingerprint Unlock, allows Pixel users to unlock devices with the screen off.
  • Improvements to battery life and app performance are highlighted in the update.

Amazon’s App Store Has This Dangerous Android Health App That Can Steal Your Data - News18
summary:
Amazon’s App Store Has This Dangerous Android Health App That Can Steal Your Data

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: News18

The Amazon App Store has been flagged for hosting a dangerous health app, BMICalculationVsn, that is capable of stealing sensitive user data. This app poses a major security risk for its thousands of users.

  • The app was identified by McAfee Labs as a potential spyware.
  • It asks for unnecessary permissions, such as access to passwords and payment details.
  • The app disguises itself as a BMI calculator, misleading users about its true intentions.
  • Users are advised to delete the app immediately to protect their data.
  • Depending on third-party app stores increases the risk of exposure to malware.
"When you click on the calculate button... the app asks permission to start recording, which is completely pointless for an app in this genre." - McAfee Labs

With potential threats from third-party app stores, it is crucial for Android users to remain vigilant and ensure they use protective measures like Google Play Protect.
newTitle: Amazon's App Store Hosts Dangerous Android Health App That Poses Data Theft Risk

summary:
Apple Is No Longer The Top Smartwatch Brand In The World: Here's The New Leader

Last Updated: December 23, 2024, 13:30 IST

Apple has dominated the consumer electronics market but has recently been surpassed by Huawei in smartwatch shipments, according to the latest IDC report. This change is driven by Huawei's innovative health-focused models and their expansion into multiple new markets.

  • Huawei has surpassed Apple in smartwatch and fitness band shipments for the first time.
  • New models like the GT5 and GT5 Pro attribute to Huawei's rise, offering advanced health-tracking features.
  • The Chinese market saw a 20% increase in wrist-worn device shipments, contrasting with a global decline.
  • Apple still leads overall, but competition from brands like Xiaomi and Samsung is intensifying.
“Chinese consumers are increasingly drawn to smartwatches and fitness bands, attracted by features such as health tracking and stylish designs.”

The smartwatch market is evolving rapidly, and while Apple remains a player, Huawei's rise indicates a shift in consumer preferences towards innovative health technology.
newTitle: Apple No Longer Leads Smartwatch Market as Huawei Takes the Lead

title: Apple-Exclusive AirDrop To Work With Android Phones? Here's What We Know - News18
summary:
Apple's AirDrop May Soon Support Android Devices

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: News18

Apple is set to expand its file-sharing capability, AirDrop, to include support for Android devices in response to European Union regulations aimed at increasing interoperability among tech platforms.

  • AirDrop, previously limited to Apple devices, may soon allow file sharing with Android.
  • The EU continues to push for tech giants to adapt their platforms for better interoperability.
  • The regulators have proposed this change following a draft shared earlier this week.
  • Apple has expressed concerns over privacy and security with this potential shift.
  • Android users currently have Quick Share, which may compete with the expanded AirDrop.
“Imagine when you can use this feature and share it with Android or Windows users from your iPhone/Mac or iPad.”

This change could significantly enhance how users share information across different platforms, making AirDrop available to a wider audience.
newTitle: Apple's AirDrop May Soon Support Android Devices

title: WhatsApp to stop working on older Android devices from 2025. Will your phone still be compatible? | Mint - Mint
summary:
WhatsApp to Stop Working on Older Android Devices from 2025 - Will Your Phone Still Be Compatible?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

WhatsApp has announced that it will stop supporting older Android devices starting January 1, 2025. Users of Android KitKat and earlier versions will need to upgrade their devices to continue using the app.

Key Points:

  • From January 1, 2025, WhatsApp will no longer function on Android KitKat or older.
  • The decision is due to limitations in hardware that can support new app features.
  • Android KitKat was released in 2013, and Google has phased out support for it.
  • Popular Android models like the Samsung Galaxy S3 and Motorola Moto G will be affected.
  • WhatsApp also plans to end support for iPhones using iOS 15.1 or older by May 5, 2025.
  • WhatsApp has introduced limited-time features for the holiday season.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“WhatsApp is ending support for older Android devices because the hardware on these older devices is not capable of supporting the new features coming to the app.”

Notable Images:

No images available.

Conclusion: Users with outdated devices will need to upgrade by 2025 to ensure continued access to WhatsApp’s functionalities.
newTitle: WhatsApp to Stop Working on Older Android Devices from 2025 - Check Your Compatibility
